ixml.comment: 2021-01-17T09:05:10.652344-07:00 creation of stack-augmented pseudo-regular grammar (SAPRG) by ixml-to-saprg.xsl.

A stack automaton guided by grammar G′and the rtn:stack attributes should recognize L(G), the same language recognized by G. If the rtn:stack attributes are ignored, this is a (pseudo-)regular grammar which recognizes the R_0 superset of L(G).

g010: the smallest possible ixml grammar (I think).
One of a series (initially for test case construction). This one is an FSA with 1 (final) state and 0 transitions. I do not believe ixml can describe an FSA with 1 nonfinal state and 0 transitions: ixml grammars require at least one rule.
L is the set consisting of the empty string.
